meanings.definition: A copy of a document or image made using a photographic process.
meanings.sent1: I needed a photoduplicate of the contract for my records.
meanings.sent2: The office had a photoduplicate of the old map.
meanings.sent3: The photoduplicate of the recipe turned out blurry, making it look like a secret code.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a photoduplicate of her mother's, capturing the same warmth and kindness.
meanings.sent5: The photoduplicate of the painting was so clear, it seemed like the original artwork.

meanings.definition: To make a copy of a document or image using a photographic process.
meanings.sent1: I will photoduplicate these important papers for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: The library can photoduplicate rare manuscripts for preservation.
meanings.sent3: He tried to photoduplicate his friend's face as a prank, but it didn't turn out well.
meanings.sent4: Her memory photoduplicated the scene, preserving every detail for years to come.
meanings.sent5: The machine can photoduplicate documents quickly and accurately.
